page.title: 20Local History LparishHPriors
page.content: In Harewood Forest is a {monument commemorating the murder of a Saxon earl, Athelwold in 963AD. {"Longparish"}is a collective name for {four separate settlements:}East and West Aston, Forton and Middleton. {Middletune }was recorded in the Domesday Book and {Longparish }came into use in the 16th. century. Pre-conquest names for {Hurstbourne {Priors}were Hissuburna and Hesseburn; {Esseburn}in the Domesday Book and Hesseburna Prioris in the 12th & 13th centuries. The word 'prioris' is thought to show that the manor belonged to the Prior of St. Swithun's Winchester. The Bishop of Winchester is the patron of the benefice of St. Andrew's Church, Hurstbourne Priors today. Text compiled by children of Longparish C.E.School. 1985.
